name: Changing Woman Initiative (CWI)
description: CWI offers culturally integrated health care tailored to Indigenous families, including preventive health screenings, nutritional workshops, traditional medicine, and full-spectrum community doula services. They focus on improving maternal health outcomes and fostering community engagement
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Tewa Women United
description: Tewa Women United provides culturally responsive prenatal, birthing, and postpartum support through their Yiya Vi Kagingdi Full Spectrum Community Doulas. They aim to reclaim traditional teachings and practices that honor birth and support families across generations
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Navajo Birthworker Collective
description: This collective works to improve the health of Navajo families by providing compassionate, unbiased, and accessible care. They are at the forefront of advocating for traditional birthing practices within healthcare systems
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Native American Professional Parent Resources (NAPPR)
address: Information not available online. (Serves Bernalillo, Cibola, and Sandoval counties)
description: NAPPR's Tribal Home Visiting program offers supportive services to expecting and new Native families, including prenatal and postpartum information, parenting support, and culturally-enhanced activities
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Presbyterian Health Plan - Turquoise Care
description: Turquoise Care is New Mexico's Medicaid Program, which partners with Presbyterian Health Plan to provide services to Native American members. They offer rewards for prenatal and postpartum visits and have a large provider network
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Moon Shadow Therapy
address: Farmington, NM (Specific address not provided online)
description: Moon Shadow Therapy offers pregnancy and postpartum support, including prenatal yoga, core and pelvic floor strengthening, and techniques to manage stress and anxiety, aiming to heal from physical and emotional traumas from birth
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Postpartum Support International - New Mexico Chapter
address: Information not available online. (Serves all areas of New Mexico)
description: This chapter aims to increase awareness, education, and treatment of perinatal mental health issues. They offer resources, support groups, and connect individuals with perinatal mental health providers
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: Harvest Of All First Nations - Ancestral Womb & Postpartum Care Program (AWPC)
address: Denver/Boulder Front Range and Native American Reservations (Specific NM address not provided)
description: AWPC offers healing treatments, reproductive and emotional health education, and support, including ancestral "Closing of the bones" ceremonies to aid in postpartum recovery
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: MECA Therapies
address: Various locations across rural and urban New Mexico
description: MECA Therapies provides maternal and family health services, including postpartum support, emotional support, physical recovery guidance, and connection to resources, with a focus on culturally sensitive care
services: American-Indian-owned Postnatal recovery in New-Mexico consultation

name: New Mexico Department of Health
address: Various health facilities and community-based programs across New Mexico
description: The Department of Health operates various health facilities and programs that may offer services relevant to maternal and child health, including community-based programs and safety net services
